labels.analysis: The KingKong Weather MCP Server is primarily focused on providing real-time weather information and forecasts through an MCP interface. Its core functionality includes retrieving current weather conditions, weather summaries by location, and verifying API status. The tools available allow users to access weather data by city name or geographic coordinates, with options to specify temperature units. This server enhances contextual awareness in LLM applications by integrating weather data seamlessly.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Weather" is chosen because the server's main purpose is to provide weather information and forecasts. The secondary label "API Integration" is included because the server interacts with OpenWeatherMap API to fetch data. The functionality fits well into the predefined "Weather" category, so no custom label is needed.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: KingKong Weather
server_info_crawled.author: @Abdirashid-dv/kingkong-weather-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide real-time weather information and forecasts through a standardized MCP interface. Enable seamless integration of weather data into LLM applications for enhanced contextual awareness. Access current conditions and forecasts easily via MCP tools and resources.

tools.name: get_current_weather
tools.description: Deploy Server KingKong Weather @Abdirashid-dv/kingkong-weather-mcp Try in Playground get_current_weather

tools.name: get_weather_by_coordinates
tools.description: Get current weather by geographical coordinates. Args: latitude: Latitude coordinate (-90 to 90) longitude: Longitude coordinate (-180 to 180) units: Temperature units - "celsius", "fahrenheit", or "kelvin"

tools.name: get_weather_summary
tools.description: Get a concise weather summary perfect for quick updates. Args: city: City name to get weather for

tools.name: check_api_status
tools.description: Check if OpenWeatherMap API is working and API key is valid.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Abdirashid-dv/kingkong-weather-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: apiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Get your free API key from https://openweathermap.org/api
